{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3361937,"name":"L Sao","username":"LSao","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-14T19:11:42.285Z","cooked":"

We are having an issue when we were running matches in practice mode. We found that at a certain point during the match, we would suddenly no longer receive values to update our pose using vision. We use two orange Pis and three cameras. One Pi is connected to a long distance telephoto camera and a regular OV2311. The other Pi is connected to a second OV2311. We checked the photonvision stream by going to the IP address of each orange pi and were able to see that each camera could see AprilTags. However, during the match, vision would stop updating suddenly. We use a PoseEstimator subsystem to update our drivetrain odometry: season2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems at testing-1884 · FRC1884/season2024 · GitHub. Our vision code is located here: season2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/Vision at testing-1884 · FRC1884/season2024 · GitHub.
When we stopped receiving vision updates in code/AdvantageScope, we could still see that the cameras were receiving pose updates in the PhotonVision GUI.
We use a helper class called PhotonPoseTracker to simplify the code for processing data from multiple cameras. However, we were wondering if passing the PhotonLib objects into this new class could be causing an issue. Weirdly enough, if we reenabled in Teleop mode or redeployed and then reenabled in practice mode, vision would start updating again.

We did not have this issue in an earlier revision of our code that only used one camera and did not separate the PhotonVision update method into a separate class.

That’s not a boosting regulator and its dropout voltage increases with load, so it will drop out earlier with two Orange Pi’s then it did with 1. Can you correlate the loss of updates with robot voltage drops in the DS log?
